com.wdullaer.materialdatetimepicker.date

Interface DateRangeLimiter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    android.os.Parcelable

    public interface DateRangeLimiter
extends android.os.Parcelable

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface android.os.Parcelable

        android.os.Parcelable.ClassLoaderCreator<T>, android.os.Parcelable.Creator<T>

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface android.os.Parcelable

        CONTENTS_FILE_DESCRIPTOR, PARCELABLE_WRITE_RETURN_VALUE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Calendar getEndDate()
      getEndDate returns the maximum selectable date of the picker It is called in various places, including the hot loop when rendering.
      default int getMaxYear()
      getMaxYear returns the maximum selectable year of the picker This method should semantically match getEndDate() It is recommended to keep the default implementation.
      default int getMinYear()
      getMinYear returns the minimum selectable year of the picker.
      java.util.Calendar getStartDate()
      getStartDate returns the minimum selectable date of the picker It is called in various places, including the hot loop when rendering.
      boolean isOutOfRange(int year, int month, int day)
      isOutOfRange is called for each date when it is about to be rendered Returning true from this function will cause that particular day to be non selectable Since this code is called in the inner loop when rendering, it is highly recommended to keep the logic as simple as possible
      java.util.Calendar setToNearestDate(java.util.Calendar day)
      setToNearestDate rounds a Date to the nearest selectable value.

      • Methods inherited from interface android.os.Parcelable

        describeContents, writeToParcel

    • Method Detail

      • getMinYear

        default int getMinYear()
        getMinYear returns the minimum selectable year of the picker. This method should match getStartDate() It is recommended to keep the default implementation This method will be removed from this interface at the next semver major
        Returns:
        the minimum selectable year of the picker

      • getMaxYear

        default int getMaxYear()
        getMaxYear returns the maximum selectable year of the picker This method should semantically match getEndDate() It is recommended to keep the default implementation. This method will be removed from this interface at the next semver major
        Returns:
        the maximum selectable year of the picker

      • getStartDate

        java.util.Calendar getStartDate()
        getStartDate returns the minimum selectable date of the picker It is called in various places, including the hot loop when rendering. It is highly recommended to keep this method as simple as possible
        Returns:
        the minimum selectable date of the picker

      • getEndDate

        java.util.Calendar getEndDate()
        getEndDate returns the maximum selectable date of the picker It is called in various places, including the hot loop when rendering. It is highly recommended to keep this method as simple as possible
        Returns:
        the maximum selectable date of the picker

      • isOutOfRange

        boolean isOutOfRange(int year,
                     int month,
                     int day)
        isOutOfRange is called for each date when it is about to be rendered Returning true from this function will cause that particular day to be non selectable Since this code is called in the inner loop when rendering, it is highly recommended to keep the logic as simple as possible
        Parameters:
        year - the year of the date
        month - the month of the date
        day - the day of the month of the date
        Returns:
        true if the date should be disabled, false otherwise

      • setToNearestDate

        java.util.Calendar setToNearestDate(java.util.Calendar day)
        setToNearestDate rounds a Date to the nearest selectable value. It is called each time the user makes a year selection: the newly resulting date might not be valid according to the constraints set by the limiter. This method is not called when the user selects a day, since the picker prevents the selection of values which satisfy `isOutOfRange`
        Parameters:
        day - a date with the current user selection
        Returns:
        the date after rounding to a selectable value
